review: I really enjoyed exploring the beautiful city of Kampala the Pearl of Africa
This is one challenging hike you could do, but once you are done, you feel the sense of accomplishments!
Woh, Living the life of Wanderlust of Uganda's beautiful national park!
If you want to explore the beauty of Uganda, just go to the source of the nile, woh! breath taking beauty!
I love the simplicity and beautiful smiles of the people of Uganda..I want to do this again some other time!
OMG, these gentle giants,..it can never get any better, Uganda is truly the pearl of Africa!
This journey tests your resolve and your strength. Just to reach the top of the mountain is what is the most epic
Never in my life have I ever seen the sun set so beautifully than in the plains of Queen Elizabeth National Park
he terrain of Kidepo is like no other, the people of Karamoja, the culture, the wild animals...something else!
These endangered species are really special, all I would ask people is to protect them.
What I loved the most out of these journey, is building your character as you challenge your self climbing the mountains of Rwenzori.
The tour kinds of Queen Elizabeth are so professional, I really loved the warm care!!!
To me, the every single journey was a plus but the take away where the crocodiles and the boat cruise through the waters of lake Albert.
The Nyegenyege dance festival at the source of the nile....the best,I want to go back sometime next year!
With sprawling savannah and soaring mountains, Kidepo Valley National Park might be the most picturesque park in all Africa

I don’t recall who it was that described Murchison Falls as the most spectacular thing to happen to the world’s longest river en route from Lake Victoria to the Mediterranean, but I’d have to agree with them.

If you like the outdoors, don't mind sweating and getting a bit dirty, and have an interest in seeing one of the most magnificent animals on the planet, read on. Seeing the gorillas in the wild is a once-in-a-lifetime experience that I wouldn't mind doing again.
Our tour guide, Jenny, was fantastic. We were able to see the main highlights of the city even though we booked at the last minute. To note, the city was extremely congested, hot, and dusty.
We stayed at upscale Mahogany Springs in the town of Buhoma, which was very nice. Then you must pay for entry to the National Park and 2 ranger guides (who are armed).
Murchison Falls National Park – where the Nile tumbles down the Rift Valley escarpment.
We had a lovely wedding hosted here and so spent the night here. The hotel is located in a spacious property right on the river Nile with lush gardens.
Jennifer was our tour guide and she made our time in Kampala absolutely wonderful. Her recommendations were really helpful and she was really flexible.
Visiting Bwindi to see the mountain gorillas was the absolute highlight of my trip to Uganda. However, there are a few things I wish had known before I went there
Visiting Rwenzori to see the mountain  was the absolute highlight of my trip to Uganda.

Uganda’s top safari park, Queen Elizabeth is the one must-visit on any Ugandan safari. It still can’t boast wildlife numbers like the best Kenyan and Tanzanian parks, but there are plenty of big animals here and it has one of the highest biodiversity ratings of any nature preserve in the world.
Blissfully remote and stunningly gorgeous
The rooms were very clean and the staff were so warm and helpful. I liked the soft pillows and that we had a variety to choose from at breakfast. .
Loved loved loved our trip to Bwindi. Seeing the magnificant mountain gorillas in their natural environment was breathtaking.

Imagine a place that looks like the Mara-Serengeti but surrounded by jagged mountains; a place full of wildlife but without another person in sight and you’re on the right track. Kidepo is Uganda’s slice of quintessential East African savanna.

I thought we'd see a few gorillas on this trek, but what we ended up with was so much more.
We found our gorillas after about a 2 hour trek. Then we sat down to observe them and they ended up observing us.
It's truly an amazing way to get out of home and explore the city like never before.You only pay a tip after the tour
OMG, hiking the mountains of rwenzori will test your level of perseverance.

Despite the diversity of its wildlife - ranging from hundreds, sometimes thousands, of Ugandan kob in the northern Kasenyi Plains, to chimps at Kyambura Gorge in the east, tree-climbing lions at Ishasha in the south and over 600 species of birds in between – Queen Elizabeth National Park is quiet and quite serene. .
Kidepo Valley National Park is by far the most remote park in Uganda. Most people fly here, but we drove the long bumpy road north, which made us appreciate its remoteness even more
I loved the hospitality of the people there,seeing the gorillas in amazing.
We booked our Gorilla tracking trip before travelling to east africa,best decision ever made, beautiful seeing these gentle giants
Despite this being Uganda’s most well-known and regularly visited wildlife area, it is far from overcrowded.

Uganda’s largest national park features on most safari itineraries because of its mix of beauty and wildlife. Four of the Big Five are here (only rhinos are absent, but they can be seen at the Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary on the drive from Kampala) and lions and leopards sightings are pretty common
Nestled up against the remote South Sudanese border in the far northeast of Uganda, Kidepo Valley National Park has long been a byword for inaccessibility and remoteness
The rooms are nice and big, the grounds are very nice with a view of the Nile. The staff is very nice and helpful. The food is ok, need more fruit like mango
It's truly an amazing way to get out of home and explore the city like never before.You only pay a tip after the tou
We visited the park as part of a week long tour of South West Uganda, with our guide. We drove through the park and saw many birds as well as several types of monkeys.
Queen Elizabeth National Park, a place of diversity and scenic beauty below the Mountains of the Moon.

On a night of a friend's Birthday, you guys were very Hospitable to us, the meals, the music, the care was that no one can ever complain of, the wines were very tasty. one of the places I visit all time I wish to be free of my mind
I can’t think of any other African park that packs quite so much biodiversity into a relatively small area, an impression backed up by an astonishing checklist of 610 bird species
See my review for gorilla safari lodge...basically you need gardening gloves, walking boots, thin waterproof and a porter!
Slammed into the northeast corner of Uganda, and jutting up against South Sudan, Kidepo Valley is unique in Uganda.
